title: Umami: The Fifth Taste
description: A fast breakdown of Umami: The Fifth Taste for builders.

hook.text: For centuries, Western science recognized only four tastes. Japan knew there was a fifth.

buildup.text: In 1908, chemist Kikunae Ikeda isolated glutamate from kelp broth and named the taste 'umami.'

twist.text: Western scientists rejected umami for nearly a century until taste receptors were found in 2002.

punchline.text: The best flavor was hiding in plain taste.
